sections.heading: FROM MALDIVES FAMILY COURT:
sections.quote: The biggest and most common cause of divorce we see is lack of communication. People not having conversations that need to be had. Many discussions should have been had BEFORE marriage.

sections.heading: THE PROBLEM:
items: Not discussing important topics before marriage
Assuming we will figure it out later
Avoiding difficult conversations
When you are in love, talking about these things is not appropriate

sections.heading: THE REALITY:
items: Love does not automatically create agreement
Assumptions lead to resentment
We will figure it out becomes Why did we not discuss this?!
Couples who discuss everything before marriage have stronger, happier marriages

slides.title: IF YOU CANNOT COMMUNICATE BEFORE MARRIAGE...

sections.heading: TRUTH:
sections.content: If you cannot have these conversations BEFORE marriage when everything is romantic and hopeful...

sections.heading: You definitely will not be able to have them DURING marriage when:
items: Money is tight
You are exhausted
Baby is crying
You are angry at each other
Resentment has built up

slides.footer: Communication skills learned NOW = Foundation for entire marriage

sections.heading: YOU WILL:
items: Learn how to communicate (active listening, I statements, PAUSE technique)
Practice communication skills
Discuss 15 essential topics that couples must agree on
Make joint decisions on major life areas
Identify where you agree (and where you do not)
Know what to put in your marital agreement

sections.heading: BY THE END:
items: You will have discussed every major life decision
You will know how to handle disagreements
You will be prepared for marriage
You will have communication framework for life together
